headline: DeWine orders flags lowered for Ohio Marine killed in training exercise
author: Jordan Unger
sentences: The flags will be flown at half-staff on all public buildings and grounds through Guernsey County, the Ohio Statehouse, the Vern Riffe Center, and the Rhodes State Office Tower, but all other public buildings in the state can also take part in the honoring.

James W. Speedy, 30, of Cambridge, Ohio, served as an administrative specialist with Marine Medium Tiltrotor Squadron 261, Marine Aircraft Group 26, 2d Marine Aircraft Wing stationed on Marine Corps Air Station New River, N.C.
COLUMBUS (WJW) â€“ Governor Mike DeWine has ordered flags to be flown at half-staff in honor of an Ohio Marine killed during a NATO training exercise Friday night.
He was one of four U.S. soldiers killed in a plane crash in a Norwegian town in the Arctic Circle during the training exercise.
Flags will remain lowered until sunset on the day of his funeral, April 9.
